result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruben Garner Jr

records.addlTxt: Bail motion by Defense argued and DENIED by the Court. All conditions remain the same.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court with Ruben Garner Jr. Defendant Ruben Garner Jr in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Arraignment. Defense counsel in receipt of Information, waived the reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. All motions to be filed within 30 days. Any evidentiary matters will be heard on the final pretrial date. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.
ORDER TO ALLOW ZOOM ACCESS TO DISCOVERY, filed.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (16 pages) commencing 09-06-22 by DEBRA WISNIEWSKI.

Defendant Ruben Garner Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared in person for Ruben Garner Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Pittman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment and to be heard on bail at the next court date. Case is adjourned to Branch 38.
Arraignment scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Case assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28 in error. Case has been reassigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner.

Defendant Ruben Garner not in court, defendant in custody.  Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini with Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State request a State V-Lee hearing, Court denied request. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Ruben Garner not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Memorandum from State Public Defender's office to the court as to attempts to appoint counsel

Received and Filed: Defendants Pro Se Notice of Motion, Motion for Bail Reduction.
RETURN ADDRESS: (RUBEN GARNER #2022006946 CELL 47) MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL, 949 N 9TH ST MILWAUKEE, WI 53233

Received and Filed: Defendants Pro Se Notice of Motion, Motion for Speedy Trial.
RETURN ADDRESS: (RUBEN GARNER #2022006946 CELL 47) MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL, 949 N 9TH ST MILWAUKEE, WI 53233

Defendant Ruben Garner not in court, defendant in custody.  Emily Zimmel appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DE; AKG
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Ruben Garner in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Ruben Garner in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ruben Garner appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.    DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
